member.name: P:Aqua.Dynamic.DynamicObjectMapperSettings.SilentlySkipUnassignableMembers
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether unasignalbe members should be skipped silenly. If set to properties which cannot be assigned due to a type mismatch are silently skipped, if set to no validation will be performed resulting in an exception when trying to assign a property value with an unmatching type. The default value is .

member.name: P:Aqua.Dynamic.DynamicObjectMapperSettings.FormatNativeTypesAsString
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether native values (numeric, datetime, etc.) should be formatted as strings. If set to all native type values are stored as strings, ohterwise native values get stored with no transformation. The default value is .

member.name: P:Aqua.Dynamic.DynamicObjectMapperSettings.UtilizeFormatterServices
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether serializable types should be formatted using . The default value is .

member.name: P:Aqua.Dynamic.DynamicObjectMapperSettings.PassthroughAquaTypeSystemTypes
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether and types should be mapped. Aqua type system types are mapped only is this value is . The default value is .

member.name: P:Aqua.Dynamic.DynamicObjectMapperSettings.PreserveMappingCache
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether a cache of mapped objects should be preserved. Caching improves performance in case of subsequentely mapping the same objects again. This should be activated for mapping immutable objects only or if otherwise known, objects don't change their state. The default value is .

member.name: P:Aqua.Dynamic.DynamicObjectMapperSettings.WrapNullAsDynamicObject
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether null values should be wrapped as . The default value is .

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.ExperimentalAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that an API is experimental and it may change in the future.
member.remarks: This attribute allows call sites to be flagged with a diagnostic that indicates that an experimental feature is used. Authors can use this attribute to ship preview features in their assemblies.

member.name: M:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.ExperimentalAttribute.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class, specifying the ID that the compiler will use when reporting a use of the API the attribute applies to.
member.param: The ID that the compiler will use when reporting a use of the API the attribute applies to.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.ExperimentalAttribute.DiagnosticId
member.summary: Gets the ID that the compiler will use when reporting a use of the API the attribute applies to.
member.remarks:
The diagnostic ID is shown in build output for warnings and errors.
This property represents the unique ID that can be used to suppress the warnings or errors, if needed.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.ExperimentalAttribute.UrlFormat
member.summary: Gets or sets the URL for corresponding documentation. The API accepts a format string instead of an actual URL, creating a generic URL that includes the diagnostic ID.
member.value: The format string that represents a URL to corresponding documentation.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.SetsRequiredMembersAttribute
member.summary: Specifies that this constructor sets all required members for the current type, and callers do not need to set any required members themselves.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.StringSyntaxAttribute
member.summary: Specifies the syntax used in a string.

member.summary: Initializes the with the identifier of the syntax used.
member.param: The syntax identifier.

member.summary: Initializes the with the identifier of the syntax used.
member.param: The syntax identifier.
Optional arguments associated with the specific syntax employed.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.StringSyntaxAttribute.Syntax
member.summary: Gets the identifier of the syntax used.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.StringSyntaxAttribute.Arguments
member.summary: Optional arguments associated with the specific syntax employed.

member.name: F:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.StringSyntaxAttribute.CompositeFormat
member.summary: The syntax identifier for strings containing composite formats for string formatting.

member.summary: The syntax identifier for strings containing date format specifiers.

member.summary: The syntax identifier for strings containing date and time format specifiers.

member.summary: The syntax identifier for strings containing format specifiers.

member.name: F:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.StringSyntaxAttribute.Json
member.summary: The syntax identifier for strings containing JavaScript Object Notation (JSON).

member.name: F:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.StringSyntaxAttribute.NumericFormat
member.summary: The syntax identifier for strings containing numeric format specifiers.

member.name: F:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.StringSyntaxAttribute.Uri
member.summary: The syntax identifier for strings containing URIs.

member.name: F:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.StringSyntaxAttribute.Xml
member.summary: The syntax identifier for strings containing XML.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.UnscopedRefAttribute
member.summary: Used to indicate a byref escapes and is not scoped.

remarks.para: There are several cases where the C# compiler treats a as implicitly - where the compiler does not allow the to escape the method.

For example:
for instance methods.
parameters that refer to types.
parameters.
This attribute is used in those instances where the should be allowed to escape.

Applying this attribute, in any form, has impact on consumers of the applicable API. It is necessary for API authors to understand the lifetime implications of applying this attribute and how it may impact their users.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.RequiresDynamicCodeAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that the specified method requires the ability to generate new code at runtime, for example through .
member.remarks: This allows tools to understand which methods are unsafe to call when compiling ahead of time.

member.name: M:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.RequiresDynamicCodeAttribute.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified message.
member.param: A message that contains information about the usage of dynamic code.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.RequiresDynamicCodeAttribute.Message
member.summary: Gets a message that contains information about the usage of dynamic code.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.RequiresDynamicCodeAttribute.Url
member.summary: Gets or sets an optional URL that contains more information about the method, why it requires dynamic code, and what options a consumer has to deal with it.

member.name: M:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.CollectionBuilderAttribute.#ctor(System.Type,System.String)
member.summary: Initialize the attribute to refer to the method on the type.
member.param: The type of the builder to use to construct the collection.
The name of the method on the builder to use to construct the collection.
member.remarks: must refer to a static method that accepts a single parameter of type and returns an instance of the collection being built containing a copy of the data from that span. In future releases of .NET, additional patterns may be supported.

member.name: P:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.CollectionBuilderAttribute.BuilderType
member.summary: Gets the type of the builder to use to construct the collection.

member.name: P:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.CollectionBuilderAttribute.MethodName
member.summary: Gets the name of the method on the builder to use to construct the collection.
member.remarks: This should match the metadata name of the target method. For example, this might be ".ctor" if targeting the type's constructor.

member.name: T:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.CompilerFeatureRequiredAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that compiler support for a particular feature is required for the location where this attribute is applied.

member.name: M:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.CompilerFeatureRequiredAttribute.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new instance of the type.
member.param: The name of the feature to indicate.

member.name: P:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.CompilerFeatureRequiredAttribute.FeatureName
member.summary: The name of the compiler feature.

member.name: P:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.CompilerFeatureRequiredAttribute.IsOptional
member.summary: If true, the compiler can choose to allow access to the location where this attribute is applied if it does not understand .

member.name: F:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.CompilerFeatureRequiredAttribute.RefStructs
member.summary: The used for the ref structs C# feature.

member.name: F:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.CompilerFeatureRequiredAttribute.RequiredMembers
member.summary: The used for the required members C# feature.

member.name: T:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.RequiredMemberAttribute
member.summary: Specifies that a type has required members or that a member is required.

member.name: T:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.RequiresLocationAttribute
member.summary: Reserved for use by a compiler for tracking metadata. This attribute should not be used by developers in source code.

member.name: T:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.DisableRuntimeMarshallingAttribute
member.summary: Disables the built-in runtime managed/unmanaged marshalling subsystem for P/Invokes, Delegate types, and unmanaged function pointer invocations.
member.remarks:
The built-in marshalling subsystem has some behaviors that cannot be changed due to backward-compatibility requirements. This attribute allows disabling the built-in subsystem and instead uses the following rules for P/Invokes, Delegates, and unmanaged function pointer invocations:
- All value types that do not contain reference type fields recursively (unmanaged in C#) are blittable - Value types that recursively have any fields that have [StructLayout(LayoutKind.Auto)] are disallowed from interop. - All reference types are disallowed from usage in interop scenarios. - SetLastError support in P/Invokes is disabled. - varargs support is disabled. - LCIDConversionAttribute support is disabled.

member.name: T:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.UnsafeAccessorAttribute
member.summary: Provides access to an inaccessible member of a specific type.

member.name: M:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.UnsafeAccessorAttribute.#ctor(System.Runtime.CompilerServices.UnsafeAccessorKind)
member.summary: Instantiates an providing access to a member of kind .
member.param: The kind of the target to which access is provided.

member.name: P:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.UnsafeAccessorAttribute.Kind
member.summary: Gets the kind of member to which access is provided.

member.name: P:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.UnsafeAccessorAttribute.Name
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the member to which access is provided.
member.remarks: The name defaults to the annotated method name if not specified. The name must be unset/null for .

member.name: T:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.UnsafeAccessorKind
member.summary: Specifies the kind of target to which an is providing access.

member.name: F:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.UnsafeAccessorKind.Constructor
member.summary: Provide access to a constructor.

member.name: F:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.UnsafeAccessorKind.Method
member.summary: Provide access to a method.

member.name: F:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.UnsafeAccessorKind.StaticMethod
member.summary: Provide access to a static method.

member.name: F:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.UnsafeAccessorKind.Field
member.summary: Provide access to a field.

member.name: F:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.UnsafeAccessorKind.StaticField
member.summary: Provide access to a static field.

member.name: T:System.Runtime.CompilerServices2.InlineArrayAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that the instance's storage is sequentially replicated "length" times.

remarks.para: This attribute can be used to annotate a type with a single field. The runtime will replicate that field in the actual type layout as many times as is specified.

member.name: M:System.Runtime.CompilerServices2.InlineArrayAttribute.#ctor(System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a new instance with the specified length.
member.param: The number of sequential fields to replicate in the inline array type.

member.name: P:System.Runtime.CompilerServices2.InlineArrayAttribute.Length
member.summary: Gets the number of sequential fields to replicate in the inline array type.

member.name: T:System.Runtime.Versioning.ObsoletedOSPlatformAttribute
member.summary: Marks APIs that were obsoleted in a given operating system version.
member.remarks: Primarily used by OS bindings to indicate APIs that should not be used anymore.
